thread.title: Super Bowl 2017 New England Patriots: World reacts to Tom Brady heroics
thread.title_full: Super Bowl 2017 New England Patriots: World reacts to Tom Brady heroics

author: Tyson Otto
title: Super Bowl 2017 New England Patriots: World reacts to Tom Brady heroics
text:
THE New England Patriots produced the single greatest comeback in the history of the Super Bowl to complete a fairytale victory that simply cannot be put into words. 
Tennis star Eugenie Bouchardâ€™s Twitter feed is perhaps the best way to explain the insanity of the first over-time victory in Super Bowl history after the Canadian glamour walked into an ambush when she publicly wrote off the Patriots.
She will live to regret it.
The international audience watching around the world was just as stunned as Bouchard at watching one of the most iconic Super Bowls. It will never be forgotten.
Hereâ€™s how the world reacted to one of sportâ€™s greatest stories.
TENNIS STARâ€™S SUPERBOWL BUST 
What are the odds? Source: AAP 
EUGENIE Bouchard has agreed to a date with a fan in a deliciously hilarious consequence of the Patriotâ€™s stunning Super Bowl comeback.
With the Patriots on the ropes at 28-3 in the second half of Super Bowl LI, the tennis star agreed to go on a date with a fan on Twitter â€” if the Patriots pulled off the greatest comeback in Super Bowl histoy.
She agreed to the proposal â€” never suspecting the incredible drama that was about to unfold on her own Twitter account.
Sure https://t.co/4W763IHkgB 
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 Then Tom Bradyâ€™s Patriots clicked into gear and things suddenly got very real for the WTA starlet.
@geniebouchard are you getting nervous?!? Lol
â€” joey johnson (@joeyj992) February 6, 2017 Omfg
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 Then, in overtime, the impossible became reality and one lucky, bold, Twitter user had scored himself dinner and a movie with one of the most desired women on the planet.
So...where do you live? https://t.co/mfucQ0C9VL 
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 Lesson learned. Never bet against Tom Brady ðŸ˜‡
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017 You gotta love Twitter.
THE GREATEST OF ALL TIME 
Unbelievable. Source: Getty Images 
THE Patriotâ€™s insane comeback has seen Super Bowl LI declared the greatest NFL season decider ever after the first half was previously heralded as one of the most boring 30 minutes of football played on the biggest day in American sport.
The first Super Bowl to ever need extra-time to separate the two teams shattered a string of records as Tom Brady once again showed he must be considered the greatest of all time with his fifth Super Bowl ring â€” the first quarter back to win the Vince Lombardi Trophy five times.
First ever #Super Bowl OT. Brady with most yards ever. Jarrett ties sack record. Like... WHAT ARE WE WATCHING?!? pic.twitter.com/VzfsWSN9AR 
â€” Matthew Smith (@MattSmithWXYZ) February 6, 2017 No Super Bowl has ever gone to overtime ever. This is history pic.twitter.com/ZruGB64BJH 
â€” Nelly Carreno (@NellyCarrenoTV) February 6, 2017 Greatest Super Bowl. Period.
â€” John Sabol (@John_Sabol) February 6, 2017 Brady: 'WE'RE BRINGING THIS SUCKER (THE LOMBARDI TROPHY) HOME." HOW SWEET IT IS. DEFLATE THAT, ROGER.
â€” Skip Bayless (@RealSkipBayless) February 6, 2017 Serena, Federer, Brady. We're so lucky to have seen three of the greatest performers ever these past few weeks, and all well over 30. Wow.
â€” kurt streeter (@kurtstreeter) February 6, 2017 The greatest comeback in #superbowl history is complete.
Tom Brady wins a record fifth Lombardi. There are no words. What a game. #SB51 pic.twitter.com/uP3HLXemMo 
â€” Marathonbet (@marathonbet) February 6, 2017 The Patriots win the Super Bowl. Tom Brady you are the GOAT. Incredible.
â€” Scott Abraham (@ScottABC7) February 6, 2017 Tom Brady with the single greatest "fuck you" performance in Super Bowl history. Maybe sports history.
â€” Tyler Conway (@jtylerconway) February 6, 2017 Tom Brady broke Kurt Warner's single-game Super Bowl record for passing yards with that completion to James White.
â€” Bryan Armen Graham (@BryanAGraham) February 6, 2017 Tom Brady has 38 completions now, a new Super Bowl record.
â€” Will Brinson (@WillBrinson) February 6, 2017 No team had ever made up more than a 10-point deficit in the Super Bowl. Patriots just erased a 25-point lead.
â€” Joe Person (@josephperson) February 6, 2017 Tom Brady's biggest comeback of his career? 24 points in 2013. At one point today the #Patriots trailed by 25 points. (via @NFLResearch ) pic.twitter.com/ATs7BS4Sxa 
â€” For The Win (@ForTheWin) February 6, 2017 Win or lose, Tom Brady is the best player in NFL history. Overcoming a second-half 25-point deficit in the Super Bowl? INSANE. #SuperBowl 
â€” Manish Mehta (@MMehtaNYDN) February 6, 2017 THE GREATEST CATCH IN THE GREATEST GAME EVER PLAYED 
Stop it. Source: AFP 
SUPER Bowl LI is certain to be remembered as the moment Tom Brady silenced all doubters, but it was Julian Edelmanâ€™s catch that will become the symbol of the Patriotâ€™s insane comeback.
Edelmanâ€™s catch is already Super Bowl folklore.
With the Patriots trailing 28-20 in the fourth quarter with the Patriots launching one final desperate drive to tie the scores, Edelman twisted his body in unfathomable directions to snare a catch in the middle of three Falcons defenders.
It will never be forgotten.
How. Did. Edelman. Catch. This? #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/ETUDLPeb6Y 
â€” FanDuel (@FanDuel) February 6, 2017 THAT IS THE GREATEST CATCH IN SUPER BOWL HISTORY
â€” TRILL GÎ”TÎ£S (@djhomicide) February 6, 2017 Top 5 catch in Super Bowl history.
â€” Jimmy Traina (@JimmyTraina) February 6, 2017 This #JulianEdelman catch is now apart of Super Bowl lore! Incredible concentration. #QueOvertime #SuperBowl 
â€” George Whitfield Jr. (@georgewhitfield) February 6, 2017 This moment in the Super Bowl right now matches the moment on Election Night when it looked like Trump could actually take Pennsylvania.
â€” Josh Jordan (@NumbersMuncher) February 6, 2017 I mean, recency bias and whatnot... but that may be the best catch in Super Bowl history... all things considered (time, score, skill, etc).
â€” Chris Long (@ChrisLongKSTP) February 6, 2017 COMMENTATORS LEFT TO LOOK STUPID BY BRADY COMEBACK 
Never write off a champion. Source: AFP 
NFL supporters were left to look foolish after writing the Patriots off during Super Bowl LI.
In their defence, nobody could have predicted the ridiculous finish to the contest.
A large group of NFL commentators were left looking like prized gibberers after writing off the Patriots at half time, declaring the end of the Patriots era and the end of quarterback Brady.
This Super Bowl really is a lot like this past Presidential election ... nobody saw this coming
â€” Dianna Russini (@diannaESPN) February 6, 2017 THIS IS NOT A DRILL!!! Falcons lead the Patriots 28-3 in the Super Bowl!! I repeat, NOT A DRILL!!!
â€” Kevin Faigle (@kevinfaiglewrdw) February 6, 2017 Ladies & Gentlemen this is officially a ROMP. Hard to believe we'd C @Patriots get annihilated in a Super Bowl -- of all places - like this.
â€” Stephen A Smith (@stephenasmith) February 6, 2017 pic.twitter.com/SGira3QgzK 
â€” Timothy Burke (@bubbaprog) February 6, 2017 The @AtlantaFalcons are making it look too easy v @Patriots . This is simply stunning! Probably one of the most shocking @SuperBowl I've seen pic.twitter.com/r7Kic9fTmH 
â€” Susan Polgar (@SusanPolgar) February 6, 2017 So far Ex-President Bush has crossed the goal line more than @Patriots - #TomBradyStinks @SuperBowl #SuperBowlSunday pic.twitter.com/wWZPhjzVUa 
â€” Gary Bobrovitz (@garybtvnews) February 6, 2017 The Super Bowl so far pic.twitter.com/6y9xTbAoJD 
â€” Kyle Feldscher (@Kyle_Feldscher) February 6, 2017 Patriots looking like Pakistan fielding this Summer. #anydanger 
â€” Neroli Meadows (@Neroli_M_FOX) February 6, 2017 Donald Trump left his Super Bowl party at 8:57 pm ET, with the Patriots down 28-3.
â€” Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) February 6, 2017 You can't call a quaterback with a 4-3 Super Bowl record the greatest of all-time
â€” Brian Webber (@bwwebber) February 6, 2017 Lady Gaga has more yards in the air than Tom Brady #Superbowl #PepsiHalftime 
â€” Matthew Kick (@MatthewKick) February 6, 2017 That look in Brady's eyes: it was despair
â€” Michael de la Merced (@m_delamerced) February 6, 2017 PATRIOTS BLOW PUNTERâ€™S INSANE PAY DAY 
Matt Ryan may never come to terms with what happened in the second half. Source: Getty Images 
NOBODY was more dismayed at the Patriotsâ€™ fightback then the TAB punter that saw his dream pay day turn to dust.
One TAB customerâ€™s $1000 bet on the Falcons to win Super Bowl LI back in August at $67 was ruined when Bradyâ€™s men forced over time and then sealed a famous victory when James White crashed into the endzone in over time.
It cost the punter a $67,000 pay day.
In live betting, Atlanta was as short at $1.03 with the TAB early in the second half.
The TAB did have one lucky punter score a massive pay day with a $20,000 bet on New England to win the match at $1.65. The individual collected $33,000.
A Sportsbet.com.au punter was clearly the biggest winner of the Super Bowl when they turned $10 into $23,712.
The punterâ€™s long-term multi-bet across AFL, NRL, NBA and the NFL had the unlikely odds of $2317.20.
The incredible gamble on the Cleveland Cavaliers ($3.20) to win the NBA Championship into the Cronulla Sharks ($6) to win the NRL grand final into the Western Bulldogs ($13) to win the AFL grand final into the Patriots to win the Super Bowl ($9.50) is the stuff of dreams.
